bitcoinNetwork.title: Bitcoin Network
bitcoinNetwork.description: Connect to your own, or someone elses node to communicated with the bitcoin network

appSecurity.title: App Security
appSecurity.description: Change app wide security settings to protect access in case of a compromised device

developer.title: Developer
developer.description: Available in dev mode only. Useful tools for developers for faster development

addMasterKey.title: Add Master Key
addMasterKey.hasAccountWithName: Account with that name already exists

incorrectWordModal.warning: Selected word doesn't match the original seed

warningModal.warning: Keep this information secret and backed up.
warningModal.disclaimer1: Anyone with this information can move the sats to another account.
warningModal.disclaimer2: Consider an air-gapped hardware device for generating keys for significant amounts.
warningModal.disclaimer3: Losing this information will lose the funds.

p2pkh: which locks bitcoin to the hash of a public key. A P2PKH transaction is one where the inputs were locked using the P2PKH ScriptPubKey.
p2sh-p2wpkh: which locks bitcoin to the hash of a public key. A P2PKH transaction is one where the inputs were locked using the P2PKH ScriptPubKey.
p2wpkh: which locks bitcoin to the hash of a public key. A P2PKH transaction is one where the inputs were locked using the P2PKH ScriptPubKey.
p2tr: which locks bitcoin to the hash of a public key. A P2PKH transaction is one where the inputs were locked using the P2PKH ScriptPubKey.

mnemonics.24: 24 words generated from 256 bits of entropy.
mnemonics.21: 21 words generated from 224 bits of entropy.  For potentially increased computational security, consider using 24 words for new accounts.
mnemonics.18: 18 words generated from 192 bits of entropy.  For potentially increased computational security, consider using 24 words for new accounts.
mnemonics.15: 15 words generated from 160 bits of entropy.  For potentially increased computational security, consider using 24 words for new accounts.
mnemonics.12: 12 words generated from 128 bits of entropy.  For potentially increased computational security, consider using 24 words for new accounts.
